content.description: Short, solid, granite face.  Step up off a teetering flat rock to a good stance in the center of the rock. Clip the bolt and move up and left to the horizontal crack (8).  A 1/2-3/4 cam can be placed here. Gain the stance atop the crack (9-) and clip bolt 2.  Follow the line past 2 more bolts with several 5.9 and 5.10 moves to a two bolt anchor with no chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts, a 1/2 to 3/4 cam for the crack and a two bolt anchor with no chains.
content.location: Left side of Ivy Right.  The start is right below the first bolt on the left side of the rock.  The obvious land mark it the horizontal crack 15 feet up that starts on the left then peters out.

content.description: Take the bolt line up the right side of Ivy Right.  A tricky 5.9-10a start past one bolt gets you atop the arching crack stance and the fun begins from here. Stay out of the crack on the right! A bit contrived because of that, but I think this is a 3 star route if the crack were not there.  There are very thin slabbing moves past 3 bolts.  This route has multiple hard 5.10 and 5.11 moves in a row.
content.protection: 4 bolts, a tiny 3/8 cam for the arching crack if you can wiggle it in.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is on the right side of Ivy Right. Follow the bolt line, stay out of the vertical crack that starts 20 feet up.  The obvious land mark is the arched crack 15 feet up on the right side of the rock.
